alert.note: Alert for Kauai North; Kauai Southwest; Maui Central Valley North; Maui Windward West; Molokai North; Molokai West; Molokai Windward; Niihau; Oahu North Shore; Waianae Coast; Windward Haleakala (Hawaii) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: High Surf Warning issued October 17 at 3:50PM HST until October 18 at 6:00PM HST by NWS Honolulu
info.description: ...HIGH SURF WARNING FOR NORTH AND WEST FACING SHORES OF NIIHAU KAUAI OAHU MOLOKAI AND NORTH FACING SHORES OF MAUI... ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY FOR WEST FACING SHORES OF THE BIG ISLAND... .The first large northwest to north-northwest swell (320 to 330 degrees) of the season will peak tonight through Wednesday morning along north and west facing shores. This swell should gradually decline late Wednesday through rest of the week. ...HIGH SURF WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM HST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Surf heights of 25 to 35 feet along north facing shores and 18 to 24 feet along west facing shores through Wednesday. * WHERE...North and west facing shores of Niihau, Kauai, Oahu, and Molokai. North facing shores of Maui. * WHEN...Until 6 PM HST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...High. Expect very strong breaking waves and powerful currents. Waves breaking in channel entrances may make navigating the channels dangerous.
info.instruction: Stay away from the shoreline along the affected coasts. Be prepared for road closures. Postpone entering or leaving channels affected by the high surf until the surf subsides.
